comments.text: Internet Explorer 6.0 (XP SP2 updated) displays www.samsonite.com in a normal fashion. Once again, whether this is due to IE handling sloppy HTML better or a minor issue with FireFox is "TBD" (to be decided).

comments.text:
that site is a challenge for IE too 
opened with IE and clicked "i" to select a country, it goes "HTTP 400"
comments.raw_text:
that site is a challenge for IE too 
opened with IE and clicked "i" to select a country, it goes "HTTP 400"

via http://web-snifer.net :

HTTP Status Code: HTTP/1.1 200 Document follows
Server:	IBM_HTTP_Server/1.3.12.7 Apache/1.3.12 (Win32)	CRLF
Date:	Mon, 13 Mar 2006 18:43:10 GMT	CRLF
ETag:	"0-20bb-440c4532"	CRLF
Accept-Ranges:	bytes	CRLF
Connection:	close	CRLF
Last-Modified:	Mon, 06 Mar 2006 14:20:34 GMT	CRLF
Content-Type:	text/plain	CRLF
                
It's a "bug" in IE that IE renders this as html because the server sends text/plain for this document.
no bug in Firefox, please contact the site owner that the server sends the wrong content-type.

-> invalid

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #3)

Yes, thank you. I finally ran the W3C validation tester as well.

W3C HTML Validator
http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=www.samsonite.com

Needless to say it fails the test miserably. I've notified Samsonite about their poorly handled active JSP website.
